item.title: Faith, Spirituality & the Future
item.description:
Faith, Spirituality & the Future

This documentary looks at how spirituality is evolving in our culture and what it means for religious institutions.

item.title: 5 Primary Shifts to Become a Place-Based Church - V3 Church Planting Movement
item.description:
5 Primary Shifts to Become a Place-Based Church - V3 Church Planting Movement

What if God is inviting us to let go of some of our defaults in order to join the Spirit in our neighborhoods?

The Rev. Emily Scott was a high-school student in the mid-1990s when she decided to make her faith her career. A gay couple exchanged vows in her family's Seattle church, even though same-sex unions hadn't yet been officially sanctioned by the Episcopal Church. "That was a key moment for me in understanding what church was about," Ms....

item.title: How a Texas Church Drove Out the Predatory Loan Industry
item.description:
How a Texas Church Drove Out the Predatory Loan Industry

Payday lenders have been having a tough time in Garland, Texas. Their storefronts have closed, their gaudy signs spray-painted over in black. In recent months, about a third have left the city of 230,000, situated 18 miles northeast of Dallas. Nobody could be more delighted at their demise than Keith Stewart, senior pastor of Springcreek, Garland's largest church.

item.title: Landmark Vatican conference rejects just war theory, asks for encyclical on nonviolence
item.description:
Landmark Vatican conference rejects just war theory, asks for encyclical on nonviolence

The participants of a first-of-its-kind Vatican conference have bluntly rejected the Catholic church's long-held teachings on just war theory, saying they have too often been used to justify violent conflicts and the global church must reconsider Jesus' teachings on nonviolence.

item.title: Five Observations in the New Era of Christian Networks-- and What Denominations Need to Learn
item.description:
Five Observations in the New Era of Christian Networks-- and What Denominations Need to Learn

The network advantage... and what denominations can learn from them | There's no denying the power, pervasiveness and efficacy of Christian networks in recent Christian history. This shift continues to gather people and gain momentum globally and I've written and given more context to networks in previous articles.

item.title: Can Neighborhoods Be Revitalized Without Gentrifying Them?
item.description:
Can Neighborhoods Be Revitalized Without Gentrifying Them?

Last year, the death of Freddie Gray in police custody placed his neighborhood in a tragic spotlight, highlighting an all-too common urban misery: epidemic poverty, blighted lots, and shattered homes. Gray's Baltimore has become notorious as the site of failed "urban renewal" projects, rife with liberal talking points but showing precious little progress in alleviating poverty and joblessness.
